Class FractalPanel.FractalWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker
      • FractalPanel.FractalWorker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture
    Enclosing class:
    FractalPanel

     class FractalPanel.FractalWorker
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker
    Thread to paint a section of the fractal to the Buffered Image.
    Author:
    Daniel

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

      Contains whether the thread has finished.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected java.lang.Object doInBackground()

    • Constructor Detail

      • FractalPanel.FractalWorker

        public FractalPanel.FractalWorker(int lower,
                          int limit,
                          int height)
        Creates the thread, and gives the limits of the area it should colour.
        Parameters:
        lower - The lower x pixel to start from.
        limit - The upper x pixel limit to end at.
        height - The height of the image to paint.

    • Method Detail

      • doInBackground

        protected java.lang.Object doInBackground()
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Loops through the section given to colour, calculates the correct colour according to the number of iterations, and colours that pixel in. Sets a boolean to true when completely finished.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class javax.swing.SwingWorker
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        SwingWorker.doInBackground()
